case_vignette: A 22-year-old woman comes to the physician because of 1 week of progressive left anterior knee pain. The pain is worse after sitting for a prolonged period of time and while ascending stairs. She first noticed the pain the day after a basketball game. She has often taken painful blows to the side of the knees while playing basketball but does not recall this having happened in the last game. Four weeks ago, she was diagnosed with a chlamydial urinary tract infection and treated with azithromycin. She is sexually active with one male partner; they use condoms inconsistently. Her vital signs are within normal limits. She is 178 cm (5 ft 10 in) tall and weighs 62 kg (137 lb); BMI is 19.6 kg/m2. Physical examination shows tenderness over the left anterior knee that is exacerbated with anterior pressure to the patella when the knee is fully extended; there is no erythema or swelling.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been having this progressive pain in the front of my left knee for a week now.
Could you tell me your age and sex, please?
I'm a 22-year-old woman.
Do you have any history of knee injuries or medical conditions that might affect your knee?
I've often been hit on the side of my knees while playing basketball, but I don't remember any particular injury in the last game.
Do you take any medications regularly, or have you taken any painkillers for this knee pain?
I haven't mentioned taking any regular medications or painkillers for my knee pain.
Do you have a family history of arthritis or other joint disorders?
I haven't said anything about my family's medical history.
Final Diagnosis: Patellofemoral Pain Syndrome
